intro: Miconia espinosae, commonly known as the Espinosa's miconia, is a species of flowering plant in the Melastomataceae family. It is native to the tropical regions of Central and South America, particularly in countries like Colombia and Ecuador. The plant is characterized by its large, heart-shaped leaves and clusters of small, white to pinkish flowers. It thrives in humid, shaded environments and is often found in lowland rainforests. Due to its ornamental value, it is sometimes cultivated in botanical gardens and conservation programs.
